poem:
A Week at the Dollar Store  

Among aisles of glinting plastic,  
canned dreams— in this small world—  
wrapped in fluorescent hum,  
each choice a whisper of unseen lands.  
From packets, the earth's borrowed time  
trickles out. Ah, to nourish  
both body and soil, both heart and home—  
a dance with the carbon-heavy air—  
what price anew?
